oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Wayne and Darrell Scott - 2005-11-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by songwriters Wayne Scott and Darrell Scott from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 12, 2005.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wayne Scott; Darrell Scott; Danny Thompson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience. Recording begins in progress. (00:00) Opening comments and songwriters introductions by Jay Orr / (05:12) Introduction and performance of Sunday With My Son (Wayne) / (10:08) The Writer (Wayne) / (12:58) Questions from the audience / (14:??) Introduction of bass player Danny Thompson / (14:50) When It's Raining After Midnight / (20:30) Question from the audience / (24:10) I Wouldn't Live In Harlan County (Wayne) / (28:25) Question from the audience / (33:18) With A Memory Like Mine (Darrell) / (39:00) Question from the audience / (41:30) This Weary Way (Wayne) / (47:54) It's The Whiskey That Eases The Pain (Wayne) / (52:40) PROGRAM END BUT RECORDING CONTINUES.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scott, Darrell, 1959-; Scott, Wayne; Thompson, Danny; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
